bookmarks.description-start: <translate><!--T:170--> You do not have game setup in your favorites list. To fix this, create a game first and then select the</translate>
bookmarks.title: <translate><!--T:169--> My favorites</translate>

expansion.meteorites-description: <translate><!--T:704--> Meteorites strike Carcassonne, causing chaos and destruction, allowing players to settle cleared areas and turn the chaos into strategic opportunities.</translate>

action.bazaar-choose-a-tile-and-your-bid: <translate><!--T:395--> Choose a tile and place your bid</translate>
action.bazaar-player-must-buy-sell-the-tile-fro: <translate><!--T:402--> Player must buy/sell the tile from/to</translate>
action.bazaar-player-must-choose-a-tile-and-bid: <translate><!--T:396--> Player must choose a tile and bid</translate>
action.bazaar-player-must-raise-bid-or-pass: <translate><!--T:400--> Player must raise bid or pass</translate>
action.crop-circles-choose-one: <translate><!--T:408--> Choose one. Each player {deploy} or {remove} meeple on/from {feature}.</translate>
action.crop-circles-player-must-choose: <translate><!--T:407--> Player must choose: Each player may deploy or must remove meeple on/from {feature}.</translate>
action.crop-circles-you-must-return-meeple: <translate><!--T:409--> You must return one of your meeple.</translate>
action.goldmines-player-must-place-a-gold-ingot: <translate><!--T:418--> Player must place a gold ingot</translate>
action.hills-and-player-must-choose-grow-or-sco: <translate><!--T:426--> Player must choose to grow the flock or score sheep for 0 points. | Player must choose to grow the flock or score sheep for {points} point. | Player must choose to grow the flock or score sheep for {points} points.</translate>
action.hills-and-receive-points-plural: <translate><!--T:425--> Receive 0 points | Receive 1 point | Receive {points} points</translate>
action.hills-and-sheep-tokens-left-plural: <translate><!--T:424--> None tokens left | 1 token left | {tokens} tokens left</translate>
action.mage-and-witch-player-must-remove-mage-o: <translate><!--T:420--> Player must remove mage or witch.</translate>
action.monasteries-how-do-you-want-place-follow: <translate><!--T:429--> How do you want to place your meeple on the special monastery?</translate>
action.player-may-move-a-meeple-from-a-city-dis: <translate><!--T:388--> Player may move a meeple from a city district.</translate>
<translate><!--T:392--> Player may move a meeple from a city district before final scoring.</translate>
action.player-may-move-a-meeple-from-the-market: <translate><!--T:390--> Player may move a meeple from the market district before final scoring.</translate>
action.player-may-place-a-meeple-in-a-city-dist: <translate><!--T:386--> Player may place a meeple in a city district.</translate>
action.player-may-place-a-meeple-next-to-alread: <translate><!--T:394--> Player may place a meeple next to one already present.</translate>
action.player-may-place-a-tile-from-supply: <translate><!--T:696--> Player may place a tile from supply</translate>
action.siege-player-can-escape-a-besieged-city: <translate><!--T:412--> Player can escape a besieged city.</translate>
action.siege-you-can-escape-a-besieged-city: <translate><!--T:411--> You can escape a besieged city.</translate>
action.tower-player-must-select-follower-for-ex: <translate><!--T:422--> Player must select meeple for exchange</translate>
action.you-may-move-a-meeple-from-a-city-distri: <translate><!--T:387--> You may move a meeple from a city district.</translate>
<translate><!--T:391--> You may move a meeple from a city district before final scoring.</translate>
action.you-may-move-a-meeple-from-the-market-di: <translate><!--T:389--> You may move a meeple from the market district before final scoring.</translate>
action.you-may-place-a-meeple-in-a-city-distric: <translate><!--T:385--> You may place a meeple in a city district.</translate>
action.you-may-place-a-meeple-next-to-already-p: <translate><!--T:393--> You may place a meeple next to one already present.</translate>
action.you-may-place-a-tile-from-supply: <translate><!--T:697--> You may place a tile from supply</translate>

element.donkey-description: <translate><!--T:667--> Donkey as an neutral figure, blocks the completion of any feature from the tile it stands on.</translate>
element.windmill-description: <translate><!--T:670--> Windmills grant points once surrounded in a large plus-shaped pattern.</translate>

tile-pack-dialog.disabled-show-remaining: <translate><!--T:372--> The game was created with an option that doesn't allow showing remaining tiles count.</translate>
tile-pack-dialog.hidden-tiles-under-hill-plural: <translate><!--T:374--> There is no unknown tile under hill. | Don't forget that 1 unknown tile from the list is hidden under a hill. | Don't forget that {count} unknown tiles from the list are hidden under hills.</translate>

open-game.name: <translate><!--T:134--> Name</translate>
open-game.share-the-key: <translate><!--T:128--> Share the key with other players to let them connect to the game.</translate>
open-game.waiting-for-host-to-start-the-game: <translate><!--T:129--> Waiting for host to start the game.</translate>

rules.acrobats-description: <translate><!--T:52--> Placing meeple as an acrobat on acrobat space.</translate>
rules.acrobats-disabled: <translate><!--T:53--> No tile with Acrobats space is in game.</translate>
rules.bazaar-description: <translate><!--T:36--> Land tiles are auctioned when a bazaar comes into play.</translate>
rules.bazaar-disabled: <translate><!--T:37--> No tile with Bazaar is in the game.</translate>
rules.cathedral-description: <translate><!--T:28--> Completed cities with cathedral ×3 instead of ×2, no points during final scoring.</translate>
rules.cathedral-disabled: <translate><!--T:29--> No tile with Cathedral is in game.</translate>
rules.escape-description: <translate><!--T:50--> Escape allowed via a neighboring monastery.</translate>
rules.escape-disabled: <translate><!--T:51--> No tile with Siege is in game.</translate>
rules.farmers-description: <translate><!--T:25--> Players are allowed to place meeples on fields.</translate>
rules.festival-description: <translate><!--T:46--> With a festival tile you can return one of your own figures instead of placing one.</translate>
rules.festival-disabled: <translate><!--T:47--> No tile with Festival is in game.</translate>
rules.flowers-description: <translate><!--T:668--> Flowers add +3 points to scored feature when they match player's token.</translate>
rules.flowers-disabled: <translate><!--T:653--> No tile with Flowers is in the game.</translate>
rules.garden-description: <translate><!--T:26--> Can be occupied by an Abbot.</translate>
rules.hill-description: <translate><!--T:38--> Used as a tiebreaker. Also hides one random tile underneath.</translate>
rules.hill-disabled: <translate><!--T:39--> No tile with Hill is in game.</translate>
rules.inn-description: <translate><!--T:30--> Completed roads with Inn ×2, no points during final scoring.</translate>
rules.inn-disabled: <translate><!--T:31--> No tile with Inn is in the game.</translate>
rules.marketplace-description: <translate><!--T:669--> Marketplaces connect several roads into a shared network that only completes when all linked roads are closed. When scored, bonus points equal to the length of the other completed roads in that network are given.</translate>
rules.marketplace-disabled: <translate><!--T:654--> No tile with Marketplace is in the game.</translate>
rules.meteorite-disabled: <translate><!--T:659--> No tile with Crater is in the game.</translate>
rules.pig-herd-description: <translate><!--T:42--> Counts as additional pig on field (farmers scores more points).</translate>
rules.pig-herd-disabled: <translate><!--T:43--> No tile with Pig Herd is in the game.</translate>
rules.portal-description: <translate><!--T:34--> Through a Magic Portal, a meeple can be placed on any tile.</translate>
rules.portal-disabled: <translate><!--T:35--> No tile with Magic Portal is in the game.</translate>
rules.princess-description: <translate><!--T:32--> Princess can remove a knight from a city.</translate>
rules.princess-disabled: <translate><!--T:33--> No tile with Princess is in the game.</translate>
rules.shrine-description: <translate><!--T:44--> Shrine placed next to a monastery competes to finish first. (second gets no points)</translate>
rules.shrine-disabled: <translate><!--T:45--> No tile with Shrine is in the game.</translate>
rules.siege-disabled: <translate><!--T:49--> No tile with Siege is in the game.</translate>
rules.starting-tiles-different-configuration: <translate><!--T:24--> Some expansions provides alternative starting configurations.</translate>
rules.vineyard-disabled: <translate><!--T:41--> No tile with Vineyard is in the game.</translate>
rules.well-description: <translate><!--T:641--> Add point per well on roads. Roads with Inn get 2 points when completed, but no points on final scoring.</translate>
rules.well-disabled: <translate><!--T:642--> No tile with Well is in the game.</translate>

timer.at-game-start-set-timer-to: <translate><!--T:115--> At game start, set timer to</translate>

barn-placement.description: <translate><!--T:63--> Barn {} be placed on a field already occupied by another barn.</translate>

bazaar-no-auction.description: <translate><!--T:69--> No bazaar bidding. Each player just chooses one tile.</translate>

coc-final-scoring.description: <translate><!--T:93--> Moving meeples from the City of Carcassonne before final scoring {}.</translate>
coc-final-scoring.market-only: <translate><!--T:94--> is allowed only from market district (C2)</translate>

count-move.description: <translate><!--T:96--> When meeple is deployed to the City of C. then the Count is moved {}.</translate>
count-move.follow-meeple: <translate><!--T:99--> to whichever district as the meeple</translate>

espace-variant.description: <translate><!--T:73--> Monastery must be placed adjacent to {} of a besieged city to escape.</translate>

festival-return.description: <translate><!--T:84--> Player may return one of their own {}.</translate>

gq11-pig-herd.description: <translate><!--T:76--> Field tile from Games Quarterly 11 expansion {}.</translate>

king-and-robber-scoring.10/20: <translate><!--T:105--> 10 points per card at the end of the game</translate>
king-and-robber-scoring.15/40: <translate><!--T:106--> 15/40 pts for having single/both cards at the end of the game</translate>
king-and-robber-scoring.continuously: <translate><!--T:107--> 1 point for every completed feature during the game</translate>
king-and-robber-scoring.default: <translate><!--T:104--> 1 point for every completed feature at the end of the game</translate>

more-tunnel-tokens.description: <translate><!--T:80--> Assign {} token sets to each player in a two/three player game.</translate>

princess-action.description: <translate><!--T:54--> The Princess {} removes a knight from a city.</translate>

tunnelize-other-expansions.description: <translate><!--T:79--> Apply tunnel rule on tiles from other expansions with depicted tunnels.</translate>

wagon-move.C1: <translate><!--T:67--> connected (road crossing or road heading to a city/monastery) (1st ed.)</translate>
wagon-move.C2: <translate><!--T:68--> a feature on the same or an adjacent tile (2nd ed.)</translate>
wagon-move.description: <translate><!--T:66--> After scored, wagon can be moved to an adjacent unoccupied, incomplete feature. Adjacent means: {}</translate>

index.automatic-updates-linux-only: <translate><!--T:164--> Automatic updates are currently supported only on the Linux platform. Please download the new version directly and update manually.</translate>

local.create-directly-from: <translate><!--T:158--> Create a new game directly from</translate>
local.title: <translate><!--T:154--> Player hosted games</translate>

online.no-random-discovery: <translate><!--T:144--> it means no random player discovery</translate>
online.online-storage-description: <translate><!--T:153--> Leaving an online game keeps the unfinished game in the background. You can rejoin it from this list whenever you want.</translate>
online.paste-a-game-key: <translate><!--T:149--> Paste a game key provided by host</translate>
online.private-games-only: <translate><!--T:143--> Only private games are now supported.</translate>
online.remove-unfinished-game-confirmation: <translate><!--T:147--> Do you want to permanently remove this unfinished game from your list?</translate>
online.some-expansions-are-playable-only-here: <translate><!--T:644--> Some expansions are playable only here</translate>
online.title: <translate><!--T:141--> Public server hosted games</translate>
online.you-have-no-game-in-progress: <translate><!--T:152--> You have no game in progress.</translate>

join-game.connect-to-remote-host: <translate><!--T:215--> Connect to remote host with created game.</translate>
join-game.description: <translate><!--T:619--> The game on remote host must be in color selection phase.</translate>
join-game.title: <translate><!--T:213--> Join Remote Game</translate>

add-ons.add-on-already-installed: <translate><!--T:279--> Add-on {id} is already installed. If you want to reinstall it, please remove it first.</translate>
add-ons.artwork-not-found-internet-connection-is: <translate><!--T:276--> Unable to locate or download add-on with default artwork. An Internet connection is needed at first run to download it.</translate>
add-ons.drag-add-on-here-or-click-here: <translate><!--T:274--> Drag add-on here (.jca file) or click here to select it.</translate>
add-ons.finish-or-leave-game-to-make-changes: <translate><!--T:271--> Please finish or leave the game first to make changes here.</translate>
add-ons.installation-is-not-allowed-during-game: <translate><!--T:270--> Installation is not allowed during game.</translate>
add-ons.invalid-add-on-multiple-folders-in-root: <translate><!--T:280--> Invalid add-on: package must contain only a single folder in the root</translate>
add-ons.not-available-new-add-ons: <translate><!--T:706--> Sorry there is no new add-on.</translate>
add-ons.please-check-connectivity-and-restart-ap: <translate><!--T:277--> Please check your connectivity and restart the app to try again.</translate>
add-ons.title: <translate><!--T:269--> Add-ons</translate>

appearance.artworks-description: <translate><!--T:267--> Additional artwork may by provided by add-ons.</translate>
appearance.title: <translate><!--T:262--> Appearance</translate>

engine.unable-to-spawn-game-engine: <translate><!--T:301--> Unable to spawn game engine. Details:</translate>

game-interface.beep-description: <translate><!--T:251--> Beep when it is your turn (or when your action is required during an opponent's turn).</translate>
game-interface.only-when-meeple-was-deployed-on-a-field: <translate><!--T:248--> only when meeple was deployed on a field</translate>
game-interface.only-when-meeple-was-deployed-on-a-tower: <translate><!--T:249--> only when meeple was deployed on a tower</translate>
game-interface.player-list-active-on-top: <translate><!--T:260--> Keep active player always on top</translate>
game-interface.player-list-description: <translate><!--T:258--> You may enable player list (right sidebar) rotation.</translate>
game-interface.player-list-local-on-top: <translate><!--T:261--> Keep local player always on top</translate>
game-interface.title: <translate><!--T:244--> Game Interface</translate>
game-interface.turn-confirmation-description: <translate><!--T:246--> Confirmation allows player to undo performed actions before activity is passed to the next player. It happens before scoring or, for example, during an opponent's turn when you move your wagon, etc. Enable explicit confirmation…</translate>

java.description: <translate><!--T:282--> Although the FanCloisterZone client is a pure native application, Java is required to play the game.</translate>
java.java-is-required: <translate><!--T:293--> Java is required to start a game.</translate>
java.java-path-is-not-valid: <translate><!--T:295--> Your manually configured Java path is not valid.</translate>
java.java-version-found: <translate><!--T:296--> Java 11 or higher is required (found {version}) to start a game.</translate>
java.select-manually: <translate><!--T:299--> Or select proper Java manually in {settings}.</translate>
java.title: <translate><!--T:281--> Java</translate>
java.unable-to-find-java: <translate><!--T:292--> Unable to locate Java on your system.</translate>
java.verify: <translate><!--T:298--> If Java is already installed, verify if Java has been added to your system path or select Java binary manually in {settings}.</translate>
java.warning-file-is-not-java-binary: <translate><!--T:288--> File doesn't look like a Java binary.</translate>
java.you-may-set-path: <translate><!--T:284--> You can set manually path to {0}</translate>

player.nickname-description: <translate><!--T:240--> Nickname used when player is assigned to a game.</translate>
player.preferred-color-description: <translate><!--T:242--> Automatically take a color after game join.</translate>
player.title: <translate><!--T:238--> Player</translate>

system.beta: <translate><!--T:701--> Prove that app and new functions are done</translate>
system.stable: <translate><!--T:702--> I want just to play and enjoy the game</translate>

tile-set.abbey-and-mayor-description: <translate><!--T:304--> Each player can also place the Abbey tile from his supply.</translate>
tile-set.abbey-and-mayor-release: <translate><!--T:303--> The fifth major expansion, released in 2007.</translate>
tile-set.base-game-description: <translate><!--T:306--> You can play tiles with 1st Edition or New edition rules (eg. gardens). This can be selected in the second step of game setup.</translate>
tile-set.bridges-castles-and-bazaars-release: <translate><!--T:309--> The eighth major expansion, released in 2010. (Sixth major expansion Count, King and Robber is split into individual small modules. Seventh, The Catapult, is obviously skipped)</translate>
tile-set.gq11-release: <translate><!--T:324--> Originally released in Games Quarterly magazine in 2006.</translate>
tile-set.hills-and-sheep-release: <translate><!--T:327--> The ninth major expansion, released in 2014.</translate>
tile-set.king-and-robber-release: <translate><!--T:331--> Originally released in 2003 as part of King & Scout and later included in the sixth major expansion: Count, King & Robber (2007)</translate>
tile-set.princess-and-dragon-release: <translate><!--T:337--> The third major expansion, released in 2005.</translate>
tile-set.river-I-release: <translate><!--T:340--> The River I is a mini expansion released in 2001.</translate>
tile-set.river-II-release: <translate><!--T:342--> The River II was released in 2006 and later included in the sixth major expansion: Count, King & Robber.</translate>
tile-set.tower-release: <translate><!--T:349--> The fourth major expansion released in 2006.</translate>
tile-set.traders-and-builders-release: <translate><!--T:351--> The second major expansion released in 2003</translate>
tile-set.winter-edition-description: <translate><!--T:357--> Basic set from Winter Edition spin-off. Contains basic game extended with 12 additional tiles.</translate>
